squares

Class CanOwn

  • java.lang.Object
    • squares.Square
      • squares.CanOwn
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Property, Train, Utility

    public abstract class CanOwn
extends Square
    This is the CanOwn class. This is to do with Squares that can be owned by a player such as Properties, Train Stations and Utilities. They have an associated Title Deed card and you can see that functionality in TitleDeed.java. The method in this class are mortgage(),demortgage() and buy() as well as setters and getters for the Title Deed card of a CanOwn object
    Author:
    Robert Keenan and Ciaran Nolan

    • Constructor Detail

      • CanOwn

        public CanOwn(java.lang.String name,
              int indexLocation,
              Square.SquareType type)
        The constructor of CanOwn is the same as Square (its parent class). It takes the name of the Square, the location of it on the board and the type such as SquareType.PROPERTY or SquareType.TRAIN which is an enum located in the Square class
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the CanOwn Object such as a Property
        indexLocation - The location of the CanOwn object on the board (its square number)
        type - The type of the CanOwn object, given in the SquareType enum form (SquareType.PROPERTY)

    • Method Detail

      • getTitleDeedCard

        public TitleDeed getTitleDeedCard()
        This is the getter for the Title Deed card of the CanOwn object and it returns a TitleDeed card object
        Returns:
        titleDeedCard, a TitleDeed object of the CanOwn object

      • setTitleDeedCard

        public void setTitleDeedCard(TitleDeed card)

        Parameters:

      • buy

        public abstract void buy(Player player,
                         java.io.BufferedReader userInput)
        Abstract method for buying a CanOwn property and this is implemented in the child classes
        Parameters:
        player - The player who wishes to buy a CanOwn object
        userInput - BufferedReader used for simulating user input for much more complex tests in JUnit

      • mortgage

        public void mortgage(Player player,
                     boolean bankruptcy)
        This is the mortgage method for a CanOwn object. It first of all detects whether the object to be mortgaged is a Property and that the Player object given as argument is, in fact, the owner of this CanOwn object. It checks if it is mortgaged already and then checks if the 2nd argument of bankruptcy is true to see if this property is being mortgaged because of this player's bankruptcy. It prompts the user for input to see if they still want to mortgage the property, adds the money to their Player object if they say yes and sets the mortgage status of the CanOwn object's Title Deed card to be mortgaged. It will sell off houses and hotels to the Bank at half their price if they are present on the square It follows the same method for the Utilities and Train Stations
        Parameters:
        player - The player who is wishing to mortgage a CanOwn object
        bankruptcy - A boolean to see if the property is being mortgaged because of the Player's bankruptcy

      • demortgage

        public void demortgage(boolean InstantDemortgageOnSale,
                       boolean demortgagedTrade)
        This method is used to remove the mortgage on a property. It first of all checks if the mortgage is present on the CanOwn object. Reduces the money for the owner depending on whether they demortgage on sale or not. It then sets the mortgage status to false and prints to the screen It follows the same type of pattern for the property if it has not been sold and is being un-mortgaged after a number of rounds
        Parameters:
        InstantDemortgageOnSale - This is to check if the property is being de-mortgaged immediately or not which determines the charge
        demortgagedTrade - Notify that the mortgaged property has been traded to another player
